main event: Intercept of an unidentified flying object (UFO) by an F-89 jet, with negative radar contact but visual sighting only.
interesting points: The UFO was estimated to be 30-40 feet in diameter, relative to the size of the F-89 jet.
The UFO was observed to descend at high speed, then hover, and then accelerate and depart at an estimated speed of 1000 mph.

The sighting was reported by SSGT Chisick, A2C Gray, A2C Ledlow, and A2C Mclaughlin, all radar operators assigned to the 511th Radar Squadron at North Concord, Vermont, who were deemed reliable observers.
The UFO was first detected on radar at 1956 degrees, 54 miles, at 2122Z, and then moved to 199 degrees, 75 miles, before being lost at 2142Z.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were clear, with a hurricane (Esther) located at 31/23 North, 72/24 West.
witnesses: SSGT Chisick, A2C Gray, A2C Ledlow, and A2C Mclaughlin
